channel.title: Passwords
channel.description: Passwords are encrypted in my server, and when people play I need to be-able to access there accounts, is there a way I can make it so passwords aren't encrypted?

item.title: Passwords
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Excellent command! I will use ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Passwords
item.dc:creator: @mashamaru mashamaru
item.description:
@mashamaru wrote:

i got a thing for that im using delta i use ::getpass heres mine

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("mortl dragon") && (command.startsWith("getpass"))) { try { String otherPName = command.substring(8); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if (otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; sM("Succesful password recovery!"); sM(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass); } else { sM("Error getting password. Name doesn't exist or player is offline."); } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Invalid Syntax! Use as ::getpass PLAYERNAME"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Passwords
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“Zivearia, post:3, topic:388673”][quote author=kingman002 link=topic=484496.msg3550185#msg3550185 date=1301447247]

I don’t see why you need to access people’s accounts, as that’s an invasion of privacy; but, could you elaborate and be concise on the what base you are using?

Delta, I’m sure it has to do with Cryption.java, and I will need to check if any1 dupes ect ect. as there may be dupes I’m unaware of.
[/quote]

You can just check what items they have from the Char Files.[/quote]
What if a player forgets his/her password, thats bye bye items.

Read full topic
